page.title: 01ARKENGARTHDALE-Review
page.content: {General Review of Arkengarthdale**} {________________________________} Most of the area is within the boundaries of the{North Yorkshire {National Park}and lies on the eastern slopes of the{Pennines.}The moorland is used for sheep rearing and grouse shooting. Many of the buildings are farm houses and barns. All of the buildings are made from local stone and the roofs are covered with stone slabs. There have been no new houses built in the dale in the last hundred years. There are no fences or hedges, the land is divided and enclosed by dry stone walls. The{Arkle Beck}winds in a south- easterly direction through the area. The river is bordered by meadowland and mixed woodland. There is a large variety of wild flowers and birds.
